meanings.definition: The outermost layer or exterior of an object.
meanings.sent1: The surface of the table was smooth and shiny.
meanings.sent2: She wiped the surface of the mirror to remove the fingerprints.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to balance on the surface of the icy pond, sliding comically.
meanings.sent4: His calm demeanor was just a surface; underneath, he was anxious and worried.
meanings.sent5: The surface of the moon appeared distant yet captivating in the night sky.

meanings.definition: The topmost layer of an area or space.
meanings.sent1: The surface of the water sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The surface of the mountain was covered in a blanket of snow.
meanings.sent3: The surface of the cake was decorated with colorful sprinkles.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the surface of a calm lake, hiding turbulent emotions beneath.
meanings.sent5: The surface of the painting seemed to come alive with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: To come to the surface; to rise to the top.
meanings.sent1: Bubbles started to surface in the boiling pot of water.
meanings.sent2: The truth began to surface despite his attempts to hide it.
meanings.sent3: His forgotten memories would surface unexpectedly during conversations.
meanings.sent4: Her fears would surface in her dreams, leaving her restless at night.
meanings.sent5: The sun would surface over the horizon, bringing warmth to the cold morning.
